node_creator Module

This module containing all graphical class for node representation.

class GUI.node_creator.SocketGraphics(socket)

Bases: QGraphicsItem

Class representing Graphic Socket in QGraphicsScene

Parameters:

socket (SocketConfig) – reference to SocketConfig

property socket_type
getSocketColor(key)

Returns the QColor for this key

changeSocketType()

Change the Socket Type

initAssets()

Initialize QObjects like QColor, QPen and QBrush

paint(painter, option, widget)

Paint socket (circle)

boundingRect()

Defining Qt’ bounding rectangle

class GUI.node_creator.SocketConfig(node, index=0, position=1, socket_type=1, multi_edges=True, socket_amount=1, is_input=False)

Bases: Serializable

Parameters:

  • node (NodeConfig) – reference to the NodeConfig containing this Socket

  • index (int) – Current index of this socket in the position

  • position – Socket position. See socket-position-constants

  • socket_type – Constant defining type(color) of this socket

  • multi_edges (bool) – Can this socket have multiple Edges connected?

  • socket_amount (int) – number of total sockets on this position (not total socket attached to node)

  • is_input (bool) – Is this an input Socket?

Instance Attributes:

  • node - reference to the NodeConfig containing this Socket

  • edges - list of Edges connected to this Socket

  • grSocket - reference to the SocketGraphics

  • position - Socket position. See socket-position-constants

  • index - Current index of this socket in the position

  • socket_type - Constant defining type(color) of this socket

  • socket_amount - number of sockets on this side (not total socket attached to node)

  • is_multi_edges - True if Socket can contain multiple Edges

  • is_input - True if this socket serves for Input

  • is_output - True if this socket serves for Output

Socket_Graphic_Class

Class representing Socket.

alias of SocketGraphics

delete()

Clean delete this Socket from graphics scene

changeSocketType(new_socket_type)

Change the socket type

Parameters:

new_socket_type (int) – new socket type

Returns:

Returns True if the socket type was actually changed

Return type:

bool

setSocketPosition()

Helper function to set Graphics Socket position. Exact socket position is calculated inside NodeConfig.

getSocketPosition()
Returns:

Returns this Socket position according to the implementation stored in NodeConfig

Return type:

x, y position

getSocketScenePosition()
Returns:

Returns this Socket position from absolute scene position

Return type:

x, y position

hasAnyEdge()

Returns True if any EdgeConfig is connected to this socket

Returns:

True if any EdgeConfig is connected to this socket

Return type:

bool

isConnected(edge)

Returns True if EdgeConfig is connected to this Socket

Parameters:

edge (EdgeConfig) – EdgeConfig to check if it is connected to this Socket

Returns:

True if Edge is connected to this socket

Return type:

bool

addEdge(edge=None)

Append an Edge to the list of connected Edges

Parameters:

edge (EdgeConfig) – EdgeConfig to connect to this Socket

removeEdge(edge)

Disconnect passed EdgeConfig from this Socket :param edge: EdgeConfig to disconnect :type edge: EdgeConfig

removeAllEdges(silent=False)

Disconnect all Edges from this Socket

determineMultiEdges(data)

Deserialization helper function. This function is here to help solve the issue of opening older files in the newer format. If the ‘multi_edges’ param is missing in the dictionary, we determine if this Socket should support multiple Edges.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Socket data in dict format for deserialization

Returns:

True if this Socket should support multi_edges

serialize()

Serialization method to serialize this class data into OrderedDict which can be easily stored in memory or file.

Returns:

data serialized in OrderedDict

Return type:

OrderedDict

deserialize(data, hashmap={}, restore_id=True)

Deserialization method which take data in python dict format with helping hashmap containing references to existing entities.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing serialized data

  • hashmap (dict) – Helper dictionary containing references (by id == key) to existing objects

  • restore_id (bool) – True if we are creating new Sockets. False is useful when loading existing Sockets of which we want to keep the existing object’s id.

Returns:

True if deserialization was successful, otherwise False

Return type:

bool

Defining Qt’ bounding rectangle

Painting the rounded rectanglar Node

class GUI.node_creator.NodeConfig(nameID, scene, inputs=[], outputs=[])

Bases: Serializable, object

Class representing Node in the Scene.

Parameters:

  • nameID (str) – Node Name show in Scene (must be unique)

  • scene (Scene) – reference to the Scene

  • inputs – list of SocketConfig types from which the Sockets will be created automatically

  • outputs – list of SocketConfig types from which the Sockets will be created automatically

Instance Attributes:

  • scene - reference to the Scene

  • node_graphic - Instance of NodeGraphics handling graphical representation in the GraphicsScene. Automatically created in the constructor

  • content - Instance of node_content which is child of QWidget representing container for all inner widgets inside of the Node. Automatically created in the constructor

  • inputs - list containing Input SocketConfig instances

GraphicNode_class

alias of NodeGraphics

NodeContent_class

alias of NodeContentWidget

Socket_class

alias of SocketConfig

property title

Title shown in the scene

Getter:

return current Node title

Setter:

sets Node title and passes it to Graphics Node class

Type:

str

property pos

Retrieve Node’s position in the Scene

Returns:

Node position

Return type:

Sets position of the Graphics Node

Parameters:

  • x – X Scene position

  • y – Y Scene position

Sets up graphics Node and Content Widget

getNodeContentClass()

Returns class representing nodeeditor constant

getGraphicsNodeClass()
initSettings()

Initialize properties and socket information

initSockets(inputs, outputs, reset=True)

Create sockets for inputs and outputs

Parameters:

  • inputs (list) – list of Socket Types (int)

  • outputs (list) – list of Socket Types (int)

  • reset (bool) – if True destroys and removes old Sockets

onEdgeConnectionChanged(new_edge)

Event handling that any connection (Edge) has changed. Currently not used…

Parameters:

new_edge (EdgeConfig) – reference to the changed EdgeConfig

onInputChanged(socket)

Event handling when Node’s input Edge has changed. We auto-mark this Node to be Dirty with all it’s descendants

Parameters:

socket (SocketConfig) – reference to the changed SocketConfig

onDeserialized(data)

Event manually called when this node was deserialized, can be used for custom use. Currently called when node is deserialized from scene Passing data containing the data which have been deserialized

onDoubleClicked(event)

Event handling double click on Graphics Node in Scene

doSelect(new_state=True)

Shortcut method for selecting/deselecting the Node

Parameters:

new_state (bool) – True if you want to select the Node. False if you want to deselect the Node

isSelected()

Returns True if current Node is selected

getSocketPosition(index, position, num_socket=1)

Get the relative x, y position of a SocketConfig. This is used for placing the Graphics Sockets on Graphics Node.

Parameters:

  • index (int) – Order number of the Socket. (0, 1, 2, …)

  • position (int) – Socket Position Constant describing where the Socket is located. See socket-position-constants

  • num_out_of (int) – Total number of Sockets on this Socket Position

Returns:

Position of described Socket on the Node

Return type:

x, y

getSocketScenePosition(socket)

Get absolute Socket posiiton in the Scene

Parameters:

socket – which Socket we want to know

Returns:

(x,y) socket’s scene position

updateConnectedEdges()

Recalculate (Refresh) positions of all connected Edges. Used for updating Graphics Edges

remove()

remove this instance (Node) from Scene

isDirty()

Is this node marked as Dirty

Returns:

True if Node is marked as Dirty

Return type:

bool

markDirty(value=True)

Mark this Node as Dirty. See evaluation for more

Parameters:

new_value (bool) – True if this Node should be Dirty. False if you want to un-dirty this Node

onMarkedDirty()

Called when this Node has been marked as Dirty. This method is supposed to be overridden

markChildrenDirty(value=True)

Mark all first level children of this Node to be Dirty. Not this Node it self. Not other descendants

Parameters:

new_value (bool) – True if children should be Dirty. False if you want to un-dirty children

markDescendantsDirty(value=True)

Mark all children and descendants of this Node to be Dirty. Not this Node it self

Parameters:

new_value (bool) – True if children and descendants should be Dirty. False if you want to un-dirty children and descendants

isInvalid()

Is this node marked as Invalid?

Returns:

True if Node is marked as Invalid

Return type:

bool

markInvalid(value=True)

Mark this Node as Invalid. See evaluation for more

Parameters:

new_value (bool) – True if this Node should be Invalid. False if you want to make this Node valid

onMarkedInvalid()

Called when this Node has been marked as Invalid. This method is supposed to be overridden

markChildrenInvalid(value=True)

Mark all first level children of this Node to be Invalid. Not this Node it self. Not other descendants

Parameters:

new_value (bool) – True if children should be Invalid. False if you want to make children valid

markDescendantsInvalid(value=True)

Mark all children and descendants of this Node to be Invalid. Not this Node it self

Parameters:

new_value (bool) – True if children and descendants should be Invalid. False if you want to make children and descendants valid

eval(index=0)

Evaluate this Node. This is supposed to be overridden. See evaluation for more

evalChildren()

Evaluate all children of this Node

getChildrenNodes()

Retreive all first-level children connected to this Node Outputs

Returns:

list of Nodes connected to this Node from all Outputs

Return type:

List[NodeConfig]

getInput(index=0)

Get the first Node connected to the Input specified by index

Parameters:

index (int) – Order number of the Input Socket

Returns:

NodeConfig which is connected to the specified Input or None if there is no connection or the index is out of range

Return type:

NodeConfig or None

getInputWithSocket(index=0)

Get the first Node connected to the Input specified by index and the connection Socket

Parameters:

index (int) – Order number of the Input Socket

Returns:

Tuple containing Node and Socket which is connected to the specified Input or None if there is no connection or the index is out of range

Return type:

(Node, Socket)

getInputWithSocketIndex(index=0)

Get the first Node connected to the Input specified by index and the connection Socket

Parameters:

index (int) – Order number of the Input Socket

Returns:

Tuple containing NodeConfig and SocketConfig which is connected to the specified Input or None if there is no connection or the index is out of range

Return type:

(NodeConfig, int)

getInputs(index=0)

Get all Nodes connected to the Input specified by index

Parameters:

index (int) – Order number of the Input Socket

Returns:

all NodeConfig instances which are connected to the specified Input or [] if there is no connection or the index is out of range

Return type:

List[NodeConfig]

getOutputs(index=0)

Get all Nodes connected to the Output specified by index

Parameters:

index (int) – Order number of the Output Socket

Returns:

all NodeConfig instances which are connected to the specified Output or [] if there is no connection or the index is out of range

Return type:

List[NodeConfig]

serialize()

Serialization method to serialize this class data into OrderedDict which can be easily stored in memory or file.

Returns:

data serialized in OrderedDict

Return type:

OrderedDict

deserialize(data, hashmap={}, restore_id=True)

Deserialization method which take data in python dict format with helping hashmap containing references to existing entities.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing serialized data

  • hashmap (dict) – Helper dictionary containing references (by id == key) to existing objects

  • restore_id (bool) – True if we are creating new Sockets. False is useful when loading existing Sockets of which we want to keep the existing object’s id.

Returns:

True if deserialization was successful, otherwise False

Return type:

bool

class GUI.node_creator.EdgeGraphics(edge, parent=None)

Bases: QGraphicsPathItem

Base class for Graphics Edge

Parameters:

  • edge (EdgeConfig) – reference to EdgeConfig

  • parent (QWidget) – parent widget

Instance attributes:

  • edge - reference to EdgeConfig

  • posSource - [x, y] source position in the Scene

  • posDestination - [x, y] destination position in the Scene

initUI()

Set up this QGraphicsPathItem

initAssets()

Initialize QObjects -> QColor, QPen and QBrush

createEdgePathCalculator()

Create instance of EdgePathBaseGraphics

determineEdgePathClass()

Decide which graphicsEdgePath class should be used to calculate path according to edgeConfig.edge_type value

makeUnselectable()

Used for drag edge to disable click detection over this graphics item

changeColor(color)

Change color of the edge from string hex value #00ff00

setColorFromSockets()

Change color according to connected sockets. Returns True if color can be determined

onSelected()

Our event handling when the edge was selected

doSelect(new_state=True)

Safe version of selecting the Graphics Node. Takes care about the selection state flag used internally

Parameters:

new_state (bool) – True to select, False to deselect

mouseReleaseEvent(event)

Overridden Qt’s method to handle selecting and deselecting this Graphics Edge

hoverEnterEvent(event)

Handle hover effect

hoverLeaveEvent(event)

Handle hover effect

setSource(x, y)

Set source point

Parameters:

  • x (float) – x position

  • y (float) – y position

setDestination(x, y)

Set destination point

Parameters:

  • x (float) – x position

  • y (float) – y position

boundingRect()

Defining Qt’ bounding rectangle

shape()

Returns QPainterPath representation of this Edge

Returns:

path representation

Return type:

QPainterPath

paint(painter, option, widget)

Qt’s overridden method to paint this Graphics Edge. Path calculated in calcPath() method

intersectsWith(p1, p2)

Does this Graphics Edge intersect with the line between point A and point B ?

Parameters:

  • p1 (QPointF) – point A

  • p2 (QPointF) – point B

Returns:

True if this Graphics Edge intersects

Return type:

bool

calcPath()

Will handle drawing QPainterPath from Point A to B. Internally there exist self.pathCalculator which is an instance of derived GraphicsEdgePathBase class containing the actual calcPath() function - computing how the edge should look like.

Returns:

QPainterPath of the edge connecting source and destination

Return type:

QPainterPath

class GUI.node_creator.EdgeConfig(scene, start_socket=None, end_socket=None, edge_type=1)

Bases: Serializable, object

Class for representing Edge in NodeEditor.

Parameters:

  • scene (Scene) – Reference to the Scene

  • start_socket (SocketConfig) – Reference to the starting socket

  • end_socket (SocketConfig or None) – Reference to the End socket or None

  • edge_type – Constant determining type of edge. See edge-type-constants

Instance Attributes:

  • scene - reference to the Scene

  • edge_graphic - Instance of EdgeGraphics subclass handling graphical representation in the QGraphicsScene.

edge_validators = []
property start_socket

Start socket

Getter:

Returns start SocketConfig

Setter:

Sets start SocketConfig safely

Type:

SocketConfig

property end_socket

End socket

Getter:

Returns end SocketConfig or None if not set

Setter:

Sets end SocketConfig safely

Type:

SocketConfig or None

property edge_type

Edge type

Getter:

get edge type constant for current Edge. See edge-type-constants

Setter:

sets new edge type. On background, creates new EdgeGraphics child class if necessary, adds this QGraphicsPathItem to the QGraphicsScene and updates edge sockets positions.

classmethod getEdgeValidators()

Return the list of Edge validator callbacks

classmethod registerEdgeValidator(validator_callback)

Register Edge Validator Callback

Parameters:

validator_callback (function) – A function handle to validate Edge

classmethod validateEdge(start_socket, end_socket)

Validate Edge agains all registered Edge Validator Callbacks

Parameters:

  • start_socket (SocketConfig) – Starting SocketConfig of Edge to check

  • end_socket (SocketConfig) – Target/End SocketConfig of Edge to check

Returns:

True if the Edge is valid or False if not

Return type:

bool

getGraphicsEdgeClass()

Returns the class representing Graphics Edge

createEdgeClassInstance()

Create instance of edge_graphics class :return: Instance of edge_graphic class representing the graphics edge in scene graphic

getOtherSocket(known_socket)

Returns the opposite socket on this Edge

Parameters:

known_socket (SocketConfig) – Provide known SocketConfig to be able to determine the opposite one.

Returns:

The oposite socket on this Edge or None

Return type:

SocketConfig or None

doSelect(new_state=True)

Provide the safe selecting/deselecting operation. In the background it takes care about the flags, notifications and storing history for undo/redo.

Parameters:

new_state (bool) – True if you want to select the Edge, False if you want to deselect the Edge

updatePositions()

Updates the internal Graphics Edge positions according to the start and end SocketConfig. This should be called if you update Edge positions.

remove_from_sockets()

Helper function which sets start and end SocketConfig to None

remove(silent_for_socket=None, silent=False)

Safely remove this Edge.

Removes Graphics Edge from the QGraphicsScene and it’s reference to all GC to clean it up. Notifies nodes previously connected NodeConfig (s) about this event.

Triggers Nodes:

  • onEdgeConnectionChanged()

  • onInputChanged()

Parameters:

  • silent_for_socket (SocketConfig) – SocketConfig of a NodeConfig which won’t be notified, when this Edge is going to be removed

  • silent (bool) – True if no events should be triggered during removing

serialize()

Serialization method to serialize this class data into OrderedDict which can be easily stored in memory or file.

Returns:

data serialized in OrderedDict

Return type:

OrderedDict

deserialize(data, hashmap={}, restore_id=True)

Deserialization method which take data in python dict format with helping hashmap containing references to existing entities.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dictionary containing serialized data

  • hashmap (dict) – Helper dictionary containing references (by id == key) to existing objects

  • restore_id (bool) – True if we are creating new Sockets. False is useful when loading existing Sockets of which we want to keep the existing object’s id.

Returns:

True if deserialization was successful, otherwise False

Return type:

bool
